thread.title: Criteo Rises After Said To Add Alibaba, Target As Customers
thread.title_full: Criteo Rises After Said To Add Alibaba, Target As Customers

title: Criteo Rises After Said To Add Alibaba, Target As Customers
text:
Reprint 
NEW YORK ( TheStreet ) -- Shares of digital marketing solutions provider Criteo ( CRTO ) are rising in early trading after research firm Pacific Crest raised its price target on the stock. The firm also notes that it appears Criteo has recently added Alibaba ( BABA ) and Target ( TGT ) as customers. 
WHAT'S NEW: In a note to investors this morning, Pacific Crest analyst Evan Wilson said that the firm's checks indicate that Criteo now has cookies on 49% of the top 100 retail and travel websites in the U.S. Wilson noted that Google ( GOOG ) has 76% of the top 100, but suggested also that its heavy overlap with Criteo reinforces the view that the two companies' cookies serve different purposes. Wilson said Target was a notable Criteo win in the U.S. during Q2, while also saying the firm discovered that some Alibaba sites outside of China now have a Criteo cookie for the first time. Wilson raised his 2016 estimates for Criteo citing the continued strong checks and increased the firm's price target on the stock to $65 from $55. 
PRICE ACTION: In early trading, Criteo grained $2.30, or 4.8%, to $49.97. 
Reporting by Jason Keil. The Fly is a leading digital publisher of real-time financial news.
